Experience Associate Account Strategist Google June 2015  – Present (3 months) Ann Arbor, MI NCAA Division 1 Student-Athlete Loyola University Chicago August 2010  –  June 2015  (4 years 11 months) Greater Chicago Area - Member of Loyola University Chicago's NCAA Divison 1 Mens Cross Country and Track & Field teams. 
-Served as the distance team's leader for the 2013-2014 and 2014-2015 school years. 
- Specialized in the long distance events on the track, including the 3,000m, 5,000m, and 10,000m. 
- Collaborate on a daily basis with a 30 diverse individuals, while striving towards common goals. 
- Assisted the head coach in workout preparation and team communication.  
- Practice 20-25 hours per week and travel each weekend for competitions, while balancing a full class load.  
- Achieved numerous All-Conference and All-Academic honors in both the Horizon League and the Missouri Valley Conference. 
- Individual Conference Champion in both the 5,000m and 10,000m race during the 2013 Horizon League Outdoor Track and Field Conference Championships. 
- Member of the 2012 Horizon League Cross Country Championship team, 2013 Horizon League Indoor Track and Field Championship team, and 2013 Horizon League Outdoor Track and Field runner up team. Google Glass Explorer Google August 2013  –  December 2014  (1 year 5 months) Greater Chicago Area - Was chosen to be one of around 8,000 Google Glass Explorers nation-wide. 
- Tested out the Google Glass Explorer edition in the academic setting and in everyday life. 
- Engaged in product demonstrations to promote Glass, and answer inquiries about the product. 
- Took part in forums and discussions related to the Google Glass product.  
- Photos, videos, and posts were featured numerous times on the Google Glass community page on Google +, the Google Glass Instagram account, and the Google Glass Explorer Volume Collection. BOLD Intern, Online Advertising Specialist Google May 2014  –  August 2014  (4 months) Ann Arbor, MI - Selected as one of 153 students to participate in the competitive internship program, receiving over 5,200 applicants.  
- Consulted with a wide range of over 300 SMB advertisers delivering the optimal advertising solutions for each customer.  
- Listened to and assessed customers’ needs, understood the details of their individual campaigns, resolved their questions and explorer how to uncover new business opportunities 
- Advised clients in the creation of Google AdWords Search, Display and YouTube video campaigns. 
- Helped set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users through online presence.  
- Provided Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis 
- Utilized expertise in Google Analytics by offering support by troubleshooting coding issues, educated advertisers in creating analytics reports, and crafted advertisers in implementing the product. 
- Worked in a structured environment, which emphasizes productivity, quality and CSAT targets. 
- Assisted the University Programs team member in planning the BOLD Intern East Coast offsite conference.  
- Tasks included: planning dining reservations, travel arrangements, team building activities, and organizing guest speakers for a group of around 60 individuals 
- Spent time working with the office's "culture club"; the team responsible for hosting the weekly "TGIF" events for office. I contributed to the organization and creation of three "TGIF" events.  
- Helped head an intern-ran TGIF event for the office. 
- Tasks included: attending meetings and creating suggestions for possible themes, entertainment options, and catering ideas. I also helped promote the week's event through word-of-mouth, email, and print advertising. Google Student Ambassador Google August 2013  –  June 2014  (11 months) Chicago, IL - Worked as the liaison between Loyola and Google by hosting various events, informational sessions, and product demonstrations to help build Google's brand on campus.  
- Selected as one of 10 Google Glass explorers to trial and build awareness for the product.  
- Worked with over 2,500 students throughout the year, and promoted Google Apps for use on campus. 
- Organized information sessions with full time employees and recruiters for students interested in technology-based roles. 
- Answered and relayed any questions and inquiries related to Google. Student-Athlete Professional Development Mentor Loyola University Chicago January 2013  –  May 2014  (1 year 5 months) Greater Chicago Area - Volunteered in the athletic department to help fellow student-athletes with their professional development. 
- Worked with the student-athletes to help them create and/or revise their resumes, apply for jobs/internships, prepare for interviews, and to create future plans.  
- Spoke about and shared insights on my experiences as an intern, campus ambassador, and a student-athlete. Digital Marketing Consultant Loyola University Chicago August 2013  –  December 2013  (5 months) Greater Chicago Area For a marketing project, worked with a real life client, who founded and ran a dog walking business in the city of Chicago. Was given a fictional $5,000 to use and allocate realistically. Was the project manager of the team, overseeing the entire project.  
 
Many of the objectives completed within the project include: 
- Improved means of social media, and advertising. Worked out issues with their website and SEO. 
- This included contacting the website developer to fix any glitches that occurred on the site. Suggested to also create more relevant and concrete tabs to webpages on the site.  
- Emphasized the importance of using their social media platforms as a mean of communication between the company and their clients.  
- Crafted multiple social media campaigns across all their social media platforms. These included posting Instagram photos and videos of the client's dogs being walked, as well as having the clients post photos to the Facebook pages for themed contests.  
- Implemented the use of Google AdWords for paid online advertising, as well as the implementation of Google Analytics to track the activity on their website. 
- Was able to increase client's Twitter following by nearly 20% during consultation time. BOLD Intern, Google Analytics Product Support Google May 2013  –  August 2013  (4 months) Ann Arbor, MI - Selected as one of around 150 interns from the competitive pool of over 5,000 applicants.  
- One of three interns specially trained for Google Analytics product support. 
- Received both Google AdWords and Google Analytics Certification. 
- Consulted with over 200 small-to-medium business owners from around the United States 
- Advised clients on how to create accounts, implement the Google Analytics tracking code, and how to best utilize the various reports offered by Google Analytics in terms of website optimization and Google AdWords advertising strategies. 
- Offered high-level customer support in relation to Google Analytics troubleshooting. 
- Also trained to give consultative session in relation to Google AdWords account optimization. 
- Held training and informational sessions for fellow interns on Google Analytics use and support. Market Research Intern Maxfield Research Inc. May 2012  –  August 2012  (4 months) Greater Minneapolis-St. Paul Area - Served as the only intern throughout the entire company: assisting in actual research projects, advising social media communication, and doing onsite observation reviews  
- Worked with clients looking to establish various types of real estates, with budgets ranging from $15,000 to $75,000. 
- Conducted preliminary demand estimates and in-depth demographic and economic research studies for clients looking to construct residential and commercial projects in a certain geographic area. 
- Compiled the research findings into written reports for the client to determine feasibility for success of the proposed projects. This program offers participants an opportunity to engage in class discussions led by HBS faculty on current management issues, analyze real-business cases with peers, and gain exposure to the benefits of HBS and other top MBA programs. 
 
Students are immersed in the renowned case method of instruction and discuss 14 HBS cases on topics including creative industries marketing, entrepreneurship, human capital strategy, and national economic policy. Each day, participants team up to analyze these business cases in preparation to examine and debate ideas through lively class interaction with peers and HBS faculty. 
 
The 2015 program accepted 88 students from a nation wide applicant pool. Admission is based on academic achievement, demonstrated leadership, and essay responses. This program offers participants an opportunity to engage in class discussions led by HBS faculty on current management issues, analyze real-business cases with peers, and gain exposure to the benefits of HBS and other top MBA programs. 
 
Students are immersed in the renowned case method of instruction and discuss 14 HBS cases on topics including creative industries marketing, entrepreneurship, human capital strategy, and national economic policy. Each day, participants team up to analyze these business cases in preparation to examine and debate ideas through lively class interaction with peers and HBS faculty. 
 
The 2015 program accepted 88 students from a nation wide applicant pool. Admission is based on academic achievement, demonstrated leadership, and essay responses.
